newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - October 14.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - October 14.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sri Lankan press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Local government polls to be held before January 1997, President Chandrika Kumaratunga tells ruling People's Alliance coalition parties.
Navy arrests 41 refugees on their way to south India from Mannar.
A group of 23 MPs attend seminar sponsored by International Alert on Irish problem in London from October 14 to 20.
Sri Lankan diplomat who chaired nuclear non-proliferation talks said to be among frontrunners in new United Nations secretary-general stakes.
Tamil groups say police should not take communal line in maintaining law and order.
Police demand power to search for and confiscate illegal arms used by former Tamil militia groups now supporting government.
Defence Ministry secretary Chandrananda de Silva says no plan to disarm former Tamil militant groups now supporting government.
Trade Ministry draws up plan to help small and medium entrepreneurs sell their products in overseas markets.
Army chief Lt. General Rohan Daluwatte says army committed to supporting soldiers disabled in fighting against Tamil Tiger rebels.
